monogr.title: The grammar warre. Or The eight parts of speach, noune, pronoune. verbe, participle, aduerbe, coniunction, preposition, interiection, altogether by the eares : Together with the lamentable burning of a petty schoole

div.head: THE TRANSLATOR, To all Tyro's, or first admitted into the Grammar Squadron.
div.l: COme hopefull young ones, and with fea • elesse fight,
View the blyth turmoyle, of a Grammer Fight.
It was a Romane field; and higher straine:
But now brought low, fought on an English plain:
That every tender head, and Infant eye,
May iudge and see, who gets the Victorie.
And though the parts of speach in conflict are,
Yet one thing Iolly Readers grant, that wee
Like Subst • ntiues and Adictiues agree.
